reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good is the location - as close as you can get to the park without staying in the park. The view of the river was stunning. It was nice to have pools to cool off in (though they were very busy)
reviews.title: pretty grim

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bad - The room was one with river view, hot tub, fire etc i.e the top range. The decor is chintzy and a bit fake but that's ok, however the kitchenette was falling apart, there was a couple of knives and two bent forks, no spoons at all and one bowl which we had to share. The carpet was so dirty it was sticky - not sure why they put carpet in the kitchenette. We noticed some crushed food on the carpet when we arrived which didn't get cleaned in the 3 days we were there.
reviews.title: Great Choice for Yosemite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room also had an unpleasant odour (maybe the carpet) which hit you when you walked in - we had to leave the patio door open the whole time. The bathroom was good though!
reviews.title: pretty good

reviews.text: We didn't fancy eating at the restaurant so just bought a couple of tins of soup and some pasta at the shop at nearly 4 dollars a tin I think it was probably the most expensive soup we've ever had. I know they have a captive audience but the prices at the shop were crazy - the shop in Yosemite park is bigger and cheaper.
reviews.title: It is what it is

likes.disliked: — The decor of the mountain view rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd stayed at the intercontinental in San francisco before coming here which was amazing and cheaper than Yosemite View so I guess our expectations may of been too high.
reviews.title: Nice and convenient place

reviews.text: Stayed one night before hitting the park. Room was splendid! Nice double jacuzzi and fireplace. view of the river was great! Staff was helpful and courteous. The staff at the restaurant are fine, but the meal was very disappointing! However, the boxed lunches were great! Because of its location, food is a bit expensive in thier store, but the restaurant for dinner is a bit steep for the quality of food.. I would choose the store and a microwave next time! Raccoons were digging in the garbage cans when we were there - not sure if that is common??
reviews.title: Nice hotel but disappointing meal

likes.disliked: — the quality of food at dinner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Yosemite View Lodge from 07/10/07 – 09/10/07 as part of our honeymoon. We were actually supposed to stay in Yosemite Lodge at the Falls within the park but our travel agent messed up; that’s another story altogether! Anyway, location wise it’s not brilliant but I think it’s the closest hotel outside of Yosemite National Park; it takes about 20 – 25 minutes to travel into the park which we found inconvenient. The room was spacious enough; there were 2 Queen size beds, a T.V, Fridge, Microwave a hob (I think) and a coffee machine. The bathroom was a decent enough size and had a bath c/w shower; everything was very clean as well. Our room had been described as having a mountain view; it failed to mention it was actually a view of Highway 140 c/w noise of traffic all night. I’ve attached a photo so you can see what I mean. We were annoyed enough that we had been booked into the wrong hotel, but if we had of intentionally booked this hotel with the hope of a mountain view we would have been deeply disappointed. Our room basically backed onto the highway and it just felt like we were staying in a crappy motel somewhere. The other annoying thing about this place was that there wasn’t even a lift to help get our luggage up the stairs; some of our bags weighed over 25kg so this was really frustrating! We didn’t eat in any of the restaurants so I can’t comment on the food; we did however order a pizza to take back to our room and this was surprisingly nice. Check in and check out was painless but we wouldn’t stay here again; next time we know to book directly with our chosen hotel like we did on other parts of our trip. We won’t rely on an incompetent travel agent next time.
reviews.title: Not Very Impressed......
Great room, eat elsewhere
reviews.text: We loved the room with the river view! Crashing waters of the Merced River were directly beyond our balcony and it lulled us to sleep after the two-headed shower, a refreshing way to end the day. Room was large and comfortable with kitchenette and the store across the way had possibilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, we made the mistake of having dinner at the restaurant. Eat elsewhere, please. The room was large, but dingy.The tables had something sticky (we were afraid to venture a guess) that made the plates, silverware, even my new sweater sticky. It was disconcerting, to say the least. Food was awful: watered-down salad dressing in a dingy salad bar, a huge LUMP of unrecognizable meat that was water-logged that they called roast beef, a few cold carrots and one hot one. We skipped dessert and fled!
reviews.title: A great hotel

reviews.text: The Awhanee Hotel, inside the park, has a fabulous brunch. It's pricy but worth every cent. We recommend saving up and enjoying it.
reviews.title: Good Accommodation but Poor Location

reviews.text: Was at Yosemite View Lodge for 5 nights. From all the reviews and photos i had read and seen prior to going i went with an open mind. When i got there it was brilliant, we had a river view which was superb. the room was just the right size. It was cleaned each day and very spacious and extremely close to the park itself. It was good to have, a choice of cooking or going out for a meal, with the kitchenette there. We stayed in and made meals ourselves. I would advise that if this is what your plans are then buy food on your way to Yosemite as it is expensive once you get there. Overall, I was very impressed!
reviews.title: Loved it.

reviews.text: More than I expected. For some reason the pictures I saw online made the property look dated but the room seemed recently remodeled. It was also a great place to stay even though it wasn't inside the park.
reviews.title: Very nice stay

reviews.text: The beds were comfortable, liked the little foe fire place, and the kitchen was complete with granite counter, stove top, fridge, and cooking utensils.
reviews.title: "Absolutely loved it"

likes.disliked: — There was nothing that we disliked.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom had a ridiculously large spa tub with two shower heads. We immensely enjoyed using both heads at the same time and wasting large amounts of water in doing so. Our room was the river side too so we had an incredible view.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: I would have to say my only complaint would be about the on-site restaurant. It took forever to get a table even though it wasn't that busy, and the food was not unlike something out of a TV dinner box. This hotel is great, just eat somewhere else.
reviews.title: A hidden gem!

likes.liked: — Staff and the restaurant, very friendly and helpful.

reviews.title: Great river view and location
reviews.text: We had a room on the second floor overlooking the river. The balcony was a great asset for relaxing after hiking in Yosemite. Several hot tubs overlooked the river as well, and at this time of the year, even though it was Easter time, you could still get your own hot tub if you desired.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room had two queen beds, which slept four adults nicely, and a full kitchen. The restaurant on site was very disappointing and overpriced. Our stove top did not get very hot and our home-cooked meal took at least twice as long to cook, but was still better than the restaurant.
reviews.title: Absolutely fine

reviews.text: We were a bit apprehensive about the Yosemite View Lodge given some of the reviews but had no real alternative so thought we'd give it a go. We stayed for 3 nights in March and it was absolutely fine! The room was huge and clean with a lovely view of the river - the jacuzzi was much appreciated after walking for hours and hours! Given the prices (and availability) of the accommodation actually in the park this is a preferable alternative just minutes from the gate and approximately 15 minutes from the valley floor. I'd wouldn't hesitate in staying there again.
reviews.title: Location good, but still problems

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel over Easter weekend. While the location is excellent-about 10 minutes-I found the hotel to have some disappointing aspects. I don't think it is worth the price per night. First, the towels are VERY (read VERY) worn and yellowed. The dishes they provided in the room were not clean and some had food still in them. The carpet was very worn. The dish towel they provided for the "kitchen" was blue at one time but was now spotted with several large bleach stains. There was no alarm clock in the room. And the toilet sounded as if a bomb went off in the bathroom each time it was flushed-I am not exaggerating. Had pizza one night and it was just so-so.
reviews.title: Nice stay outside the Park.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As mentioned earlier, the location was wonderful. The bathroom was spacious. The pools looked nice. The small grocery store on site was convienent but way overpriced.
reviews.title: Had a great time

reviews.text: Stayed here 3 nights with our 2 kids. Excellent location close to the sights. Nice room with two queen beds side by side, AC, big tv, fridge, big bathroom with spa. Cooking facilities. Excellent balcony on 2nd floor with stunning view of the Merced river - and pleasant river sounds. Important: Be sure to book a room with a river view. Get one on the 2nd floor, the lower ones are bothered by animals looking for food. OK outdoor pool plus indoor pool. Parking close to room.Small food shop, not much to choose from here. Pizza restaurant + nice restaurant right by the river.
reviews.title: Good if you get the right room

likes.disliked: — Not enough to choose from in the food market - you end up having to eat in a restaurant event though there is a nice kitchen available in the room

reviews.text: Nice village feeling. Price reasonable. Book early.
reviews.title: Great View and Location, shame about the dining experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived on Sat afternoon after a fabulous 2 night stay at the Hyatt Vineyard, Santa Rosa
reviews.title: Nearest Accomodation to the Park - Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Low expectations as 24 hours previously the hotel had been running off a generator due to the forest fire issue in the area so we were lucky that full power had been restored to the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First impressions were that the location was great (next to Merced River) but the buildings were slightly dated.
reviews.title: Great location but bring your own food

likes.liked: — Huge rooms and closeness to Yosemite
likes.disliked: — Restaurant is limited and not very good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Yosemite View Lodge for two nights in early September following a long drive from San Francisco, arriving at about 6:00pm in the evening. We'd thought the hotel was actually in the National Park and tried to check in at a lodge in the park with a similar-sounding name, only to be told the Yosemite View Lodge was quite a drive away outside of the Park. Apparently this is quite a common mistake, but we should really have read the directions we were given properly.
reviews.title: Satisfactory Accommodation Close To Yosemite

likes.disliked: — The Restaurant Food Was Below Par

reviews.title: Better Than Expected
reviews.text: We'd booked a river view and walked onto our balcony to be greeted with the sound of a wonderful rushing river tumbling over boulders. The room was fine with a jacuzzi bath tub.

The meals weren't great however. The first night we at in the restaurant. My partner had fish which was still frozen in the middle, but I was quite happy with my meal. We had a takeaway pizza the following night which was rather average.
reviews.title: Loved It!!!

likes.disliked: — parking being reserved for tour busses and having to park away from the room

reviews.text: It was lovely to sit with a drink overlooking the river and we were surprised to see hummingbirds flitting around.
reviews.title: The best you will get in El Portal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very happy with the setting, but the hotel itself was a bit below par.
reviews.title: Only worthwhile for it's river view & locality to Yosemite NP entrance

likes.liked: — Location to Yosemite NP entrance & breathtaking views

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night after spending the day at the park. We booked through hotels.com and found out later that we could have spent much less by contacting the hotel directly. The complex is huge and it was difficult to even find the office to check in. Our room was on the third floor with the river outside our balcony. A previous reviewer had written that the river was annoyingly loud and I thought that was crazy until I heard it myself - we had to sleep with the windows closed!
reviews.title: Not a great choice

likes.disliked: — Poor service, expensive dining, lack of bathroom fan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was simple, outdated but clean. We called the desk because we had no remote control for the TV and no clock in our room. They said they would send them but never did. We called back and were told that they don't provide clocks but could arrange a wake-up call. I said that I would like to be able to tell the time at any given moment but that didn't seem to make any difference. They ended up sending a TV remote up but refused to send a channel list, saying we had to come down to get that ourselves.
reviews.title: This place is an expensive joke

reviews.text: The bathroom had no exhaust fan and just one window facing the public walkway, so we found ourselves overwhelmed with steam each time one of us took a shower.
reviews.title: Nice stay, great river view

reviews.text: The pizza restaurant was quite good but as other reviewers have noted, very overpriced.
reviews.title: Loved the view f/our room..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved Yosemite but would find other lodging if we were to return.
reviews.title: Great location but pretty average

reviews.text: The Yosemite View Lodge was such a pleasant surprise! Our family of two adults and two teenagers visited in July '07. It is located just outside the western entrance of the park. We had a river view room with the river right next to our porch. The room was much nicer than we expected. It was clean and nicely decorated. There was a fireplace, jacuzzi, and refrigerator. There was a nice size laundromat and we never had a problem getting a machine. We stayed 3 nights. I had to book two nights through AAA and one through the motel's web site but I emailed the hotel a week or so in advance and we didn't have to change rooms. (We had booked the same type of room so I'm sure that helped). It was only about a 10 or 15 minute beautiful drive to the Valley floor. We got take out from the motel's restaurants two nights because we were too tired to mess with going out. The food was fine - nothing special but so easy and convenient. We had pizza one night and pasta the other. The night in between we ate at the Awhanee. It was good but you definitely go for the experience because it's pricey. I would recommend going to the Awhanee before it gets dark so you can walk out back and enjoy the view.
reviews.title: So Much Nicer Than We Expected

likes.liked: — The view out our backdoor, away from the Valley crowds, and convenient to Yosmite
likes.disliked: — Nothing really negative but I'd say the food was just average to fair

reviews.text: I'm glad we ended up at the Yosemite View. I had orginally wanted to stay in the Valley but it was so crowded in July that I was happy to have an escape. We had some friends who stayed outside the south entrance and complained about the traffic coming into the park. We never had an issue with traffic. Before you go into the valley try and get a bus map so you can plan in advance. (Be warned that some of the stops are further apart than they appear.) Also, if you are going during a busy time of year the Valley gets very crowded so get up early and get a head start.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the Yosemite View by accident after phoning numerous hotels in the valley we were unsure as to the location of this lodge. We were more than surprised that it only took around ten minutes to get in and out of the valley.
reviews.title: Adequate but showing its age

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the facilities in the room useful and although maybe an update in decor would make it a little better it was clean and the view of the river was fantastic. The food on site was not great, but the accommodations themselves and the fact that we had our own kitchenette more than made up for this. We enjoyed our stay so much we are hoping to go back in 2008.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The Yosemite View Lodge is located a very short distance from the entrance to beautiful Yosemite National Park on Highway 140. A prime location for attracting visitors, but the quality of the facility doesn't match the wonderful location.
reviews.title: Yosemite View Lodge - First Family Trip to Yosemite Park

likes.disliked: — At check out, we were given a sheet of much lower price rates with larger rooms.
